meanings.definition: Having homes or other establishments on both the East and West coasts of the United States.
meanings.sent1: She is a bicoastal businesswoman, owning a house in New York and another in California.
meanings.sent2: The actor's bicoastal lifestyle allows him to enjoy the beaches of both California and Florida.
meanings.sent3: Being bicoastal means always having to pack for two different climates!
meanings.sent4: Her bicoastal nature mirrors the ebb and flow of the ocean, constantly moving between shores.
meanings.sent5: The bicoastal view from her windows is a daily reminder of the vastness of the country.

meanings.definition: Traveling frequently between the East and West coasts of the United States.
meanings.sent1: The bicoastal executive spends half his time in New York and the other half in Los Angeles.
meanings.sent2: Their bicoastal relationship requires a lot of plane tickets and time zone adjustments.
meanings.sent3: The bicoastal flight attendants have mastered the art of napping on short layovers.
meanings.sent4: His bicoastal journey feels like a never-ending adventure across the country.
meanings.sent5: Bicoastal travelers often have the best tips for beating jet lag.
